content: rory gilmore sweater recipe by gia giaetcetera pilot gilmore girls season 1 episode 1 2000 this is a self drafted recipe based on the oversized cable knit sweater rory wears in the pilot episode of gilmore girls it is knitted flat bottom-up and seamed at the end using mattress stitch the collar is worked in the round this sweater features a drop shoulder and extra long sleeves to be rolled up please read through the entire pattern before starting especially if you plan on adjusting for size as there are tips marked with * gauge 18 stitches x 24 row in moss stitch = 4 x 4 in / 10 x 10 cm more on gauge and measurements on next page materials -17 skeins drops nepal in off white or any similar yarn 50 g = 75m / 82 yd 850g total = 1275m / 1394 yd keep in mind yarn usage will change if you make the sweater bigger or smaller -us 7 4 5mm knitting needles -us 9 5 5mm knitting needles -stitch markers -tapestry needle -cable needle posted for free only on ravelry ©copyright gia giaetcetra 2025 1 finished measurements bust 48 length 25 5 measured from center back not including collar sleeve length 20 5 including ribbing made extra long to account for rolling them up 14 positive ease shown in photo the easiest way to make this sweater larger or smaller is to add or subtract moss stitches from the ends of each panel the center diamond pattern can also be made bigger or smaller for example the sleeve diamond section in chart c is 25 stitches and the body diamond section in chart a is 27 stitches as long as you add/subtract an equal number of stitches on either side maintain an odd number and start and end the section with a p on rs k on ws stitch the pattern will work out this will also change the length of the diamond so keep that in mind this pattern can be made to measure this is how i figured out my stitch count make a swatch using part of chart a including some moss stitch on one end i did 45 stitches total block the swatch as cables tend to grow when blocked measure the swatch and set up this equation total swatch stitches cross multiply total stitches for panel swatch measurement = desired size half of bust mine 45 stitches = x stitches 45 x 24 = 1080 9 inches 24 inches 1080 / 9 = 120 need uneven number so round to 121 use this same equation using length of swatch to find amount of row you can also use this equation for the sleeve set up 2 equations 1 for desired size of bottom of sleeve 1 for desired size of top of sleeve the difference in stitches is how many total stitches you have to increase throughout the sleeve panel divide the
